title: [Gameplay] Constant disconnects getting worse
body:
_I am playing on a wired connection._

During pretty much every single game I've played in the past week, I've been randomly disconnecting for ~30 seconds, and it's been happening as often as every few minutes. This hasn't happened a single time in any of the other games I've played recently (CS:GO, SC2, H1Z1). During these disconnects, I can still fully use Google Chrome, and I don't disconnect from Skype, TeamSpeak, or Discord. People can still hear me without any signs of lag and they can see everything I post in chat instantly.
 I've tried multiple things to fix this, none of which have worked. I have tried:
**-** Repairing my client
**-** Completely reinstalling League
**-** Contacting my ISP
**-** Running League as Admin
**-** Running League through Razer Cortex
**-** Running League without anything else running in the background
**-** Disabling IP Helper in services.msc (I read that a few months ago when people were having similar issues that this helped)
**-** Doing the same three things after "Contacting my ISP" after Disabling IP Helper

I'm nearly to the point of just quitting League until this is fixed, although I'm really reluctant to do so because I want to get to Gold before the season ends. {{item:3070}} 
I just feel that it's wrong to make other players' games ~~shitty~~ less fun _knowing_ that I'll disconnect many times during that game.
If _anyone_ has any ideas on how to fix this, please feel free to comment. This is getting extremely annoying, and I'd hate to stop playing my favorite video game because of it.

- _Orlynow_, The Rift Inquisitor
